what benefits do 64bit have to offer?: for 'regular people'?  More address space for RAM

No (well, not directly), but with the wider datawidth, you can do larger computations faster, and also the architecture itself has a number of improvements, lack of register starvation, etc.  But for the stuff most people do, the biggest benefit is that you have have more RAM (more than 3.2ish GB)
The same size as regular Ubuntu, 2G or so.
